004
005package edu.wpi.first.math.controller;
006
007import edu.wpi.first.math.MathSharedStore;
008import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUsageId;
009import edu.wpi.first.math.MathUtil;
010import edu.wpi.first.math.trajectory.TrapezoidProfile;
011import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.Sendable;
012import edu.wpi.first.util.sendable.SendableBuilder;
013
014/**
015 * Implements a PID control loop whose setpoint is constrained by a trapezoid profile. Users should
016 * call reset() when they first start running the controller to avoid unwanted behavior.
017 */
018public class ProfiledPIDController implements Sendable {
019  private static int instances;
020
021  private PIDController m_controller;
022  private double m_minimumInput;
023  private double m_maximumInput;
024  private TrapezoidProfile.State m_goal = new TrapezoidProfile.State();
025  private TrapezoidProfile.State m_setpoint = new TrapezoidProfile.State();
026  private TrapezoidProfile.Constraints m_constraints;
027
028  /**
029   * Allocates a ProfiledPIDController with the given constants for Kp, Ki, and Kd.
030   *
031   * @param Kp The proportional coefficient.
032   * @param Ki The integral coefficient.
033   * @param Kd The derivative coefficient.
034   * @param constraints Velocity and acceleration constraints for goal.
035   */
036  public ProfiledPIDController(
037      double Kp, double Ki, double Kd, TrapezoidProfile.Constraints constraints) {
038    this(Kp, Ki, Kd, constraints, 0.02);
039  }
040
041  /**
042   * Allocates a ProfiledPIDController with the given constants for Kp, Ki, and Kd.
043   *
044   * @param Kp The proportional coefficient.
045   * @param Ki The integral coefficient.
046   * @param Kd The derivative coefficient.
047   * @param constraints Velocity and acceleration constraints for goal.
048   * @param period The period between controller updates in seconds. The default is 0.02 seconds.
049   */
050  public ProfiledPIDController(
051      double Kp, double Ki, double Kd, TrapezoidProfile.Constraints constraints, double period) {
052    m_controller = new PIDController(Kp, Ki, Kd, period);
053    m_constraints = constraints;
054    instances++;
055    MathSharedStore.reportUsage(MathUsageId.kController_ProfiledPIDController, instances);
056  }
057
058  /**
059   * Sets the PID Controller gain parameters.
060   *
061   * <p>Sets the proportional, integral, and differential coefficients.
062   *
063   * @param Kp Proportional coefficient
064   * @param Ki Integral coefficient
065   * @param Kd Differential coefficient
066   */
067  public void setPID(double Kp, double Ki, double Kd) {
068    m_controller.setPID(Kp, Ki, Kd);
069  }
070
071  /**
072   * Sets the proportional coefficient of the PID controller gain.
073   *
074   * @param Kp proportional coefficient
075   */
076  public void setP(double Kp) {
077    m_controller.setP(Kp);
078  }
079
080  /**
081   * Sets the integral coefficient of the PID controller gain.
082   *
083   * @param Ki integral coefficient
084   */
085  public void setI(double Ki) {
086    m_controller.setI(Ki);
087  }
088
089  /**
090   * Sets the differential coefficient of the PID controller gain.
091   *
092   * @param Kd differential coefficient
093   */
094  public void setD(double Kd) {
095    m_controller.setD(Kd);
096  }
097
098  /**
099   * Gets the proportional coefficient.
100   *
101   * @return proportional coefficient
102   */
103  public double getP() {
104    return m_controller.getP();
105  }
106
107  /**
108   * Gets the integral coefficient.
109   *
110   * @return integral coefficient
111   */
112  public double getI() {
113    return m_controller.getI();
114  }
115
116  /**
117   * Gets the differential coefficient.
118   *
119   * @return differential coefficient
120   */
121  public double getD() {
122    return m_controller.getD();
123  }
124
125  /**
126   * Gets the period of this controller.
127   *
128   * @return The period of the controller.
129   */
130  public double getPeriod() {
131    return m_controller.getPeriod();
132  }
133
134  /**
135   * Returns the position tolerance of this controller.
136   *
137   * @return the position tolerance of the controller.
138   */
139  public double getPositionTolerance() {
140    return m_controller.getPositionTolerance();
141  }
142
143  /**
144   * Returns the velocity tolerance of this controller.
145   *
146   * @return the velocity tolerance of the controller.
147   */
148  public double getVelocityTolerance() {
149    return m_controller.getVelocityTolerance();
150  }
151
152  /**
153   * Sets the goal for the ProfiledPIDController.
154   *
155   * @param goal The desired goal state.
156   */
157  public void setGoal(TrapezoidProfile.State goal) {
158    m_goal = goal;
159  }
160
161  /**
162   * Sets the goal for the ProfiledPIDController.
163   *
164   * @param goal The desired goal position.
165   */
166  public void setGoal(double goal) {
167    m_goal = new TrapezoidProfile.State(goal, 0);
168  }
169
170  /**
171   * Gets the goal for the ProfiledPIDController.
172   *
173   * @return The goal.
174   */
175  public TrapezoidProfile.State getGoal() {
176    return m_goal;
177  }
178
179  /**
180   * Returns true if the error is within the tolerance of the error.
181   *
182   * <p>This will return false until at least one input value has been computed.
183   *
184   * @return True if the error is within the tolerance of the error.
185   */
186  public boolean atGoal() {
187    return atSetpoint() && m_goal.equals(m_setpoint);
188  }
189
190  /**
191   * Set velocity and acceleration constraints for goal.
192   *
193   * @param constraints Velocity and acceleration constraints for goal.
194   */
195  public void setConstraints(TrapezoidProfile.Constraints constraints) {
196    m_constraints = constraints;
197  }
198
199  /**
200   * Returns the current setpoint of the ProfiledPIDController.
201   *
202   * @return The current setpoint.
203   */
204  public TrapezoidProfile.State getSetpoint() {
205    return m_setpoint;
206  }
207
208  /**
209   * Returns true if the error is within the tolerance of the error.
210   *
211   * <p>This will return false until at least one input value has been computed.
212   *
213   * @return True if the error is within the tolerance of the error.
214   */
215  public boolean atSetpoint() {
216    return m_controller.atSetpoint();
217  }
218
219  /**
220   * Enables continuous input.
221   *
222   * <p>Rather then using the max and min input range as constraints, it considers them to be the
223   * same point and automatically calculates the shortest route to the setpoint.
224   *
225   * @param minimumInput The minimum value expected from the input.
226   * @param maximumInput The maximum value expected from the input.
227   */
228  public void enableContinuousInput(double minimumInput, double maximumInput) {
229    m_controller.enableContinuousInput(minimumInput, maximumInput);
230    m_minimumInput = minimumInput;
231    m_maximumInput = maximumInput;
232  }
233
234  /** Disables continuous input. */
235  public void disableContinuousInput() {
236    m_controller.disableContinuousInput();
237  }
238
239  /**
240   * Sets the minimum and maximum values for the integrator.
241   *
242   * <p>When the cap is reached, the integrator value is added to the controller output rather than
243   * the integrator value times the integral gain.
244   *
245   * @param minimumIntegral The minimum value of the integrator.
246   * @param maximumIntegral The maximum value of the integrator.
247   */
248  public void setIntegratorRange(double minimumIntegral, double maximumIntegral) {
249    m_controller.setIntegratorRange(minimumIntegral, maximumIntegral);
250  }
251
252  /**
253   * Sets the error which is considered tolerable for use with atSetpoint().
254   *
255   * @param positionTolerance Position error which is tolerable.
256   */
257  public void setTolerance(double positionTolerance) {
258    setTolerance(positionTolerance, Double.POSITIVE_INFINITY);
259  }
260
261  /**
262   * Sets the error which is considered tolerable for use with atSetpoint().
263   *
264   * @param positionTolerance Position error which is tolerable.
265   * @param velocityTolerance Velocity error which is tolerable.
266   */
267  public void setTolerance(double positionTolerance, double velocityTolerance) {
268    m_controller.setTolerance(positionTolerance, velocityTolerance);
269  }
270
271  /**
272   * Returns the difference between the setpoint and the measurement.
273   *
274   * @return The error.
275   */
276  public double getPositionError() {
277    return m_controller.getPositionError();
278  }
279
280  /**
281   * Returns the change in error per second.
282   *
283   * @return The change in error per second.
284   */
285  public double getVelocityError() {
286    return m_controller.getVelocityError();
287  }
288
289  /**
290   * Returns the next output of the PID controller.
291   *
292   * @param measurement The current measurement of the process variable.
293   * @return The controller's next output.
294   */
295  public double calculate(double measurement) {
296    if (m_controller.isContinuousInputEnabled()) {
297      // Get error which is smallest distance between goal and measurement
298      double errorBound = (m_maximumInput - m_minimumInput) / 2.0;
299      double goalMinDistance =
300          MathUtil.inputModulus(m_goal.position - measurement, -errorBound, errorBound);
301      double setpointMinDistance =
302          MathUtil.inputModulus(m_setpoint.position - measurement, -errorBound, errorBound);
303
304      // Recompute the profile goal with the smallest error, thus giving the shortest path. The goal
305      // may be outside the input range after this operation, but that's OK because the controller
306      // will still go there and report an error of zero. In other words, the setpoint only needs to
307      // be offset from the measurement by the input range modulus; they don't need to be equal.
308      m_goal.position = goalMinDistance + measurement;
309      m_setpoint.position = setpointMinDistance + measurement;
310    }
311
312    var profile = new TrapezoidProfile(m_constraints, m_goal, m_setpoint);
313    m_setpoint = profile.calculate(getPeriod());
314    return m_controller.calculate(measurement, m_setpoint.position);
315  }
316
317  /**
318   * Returns the next output of the PID controller.
319   *
320   * @param measurement The current measurement of the process variable.
321   * @param goal The new goal of the controller.
322   * @return The controller's next output.
323   */
324  public double calculate(double measurement, TrapezoidProfile.State goal) {
325    setGoal(goal);
326    return calculate(measurement);
327  }
328
329  /**
330   * Returns the next output of the PIDController.
331   *
332   * @param measurement The current measurement of the process variable.
333   * @param goal The new goal of the controller.
334   * @return The controller's next output.
335   */
336  public double calculate(double measurement, double goal) {
337    setGoal(goal);
338    return calculate(measurement);
339  }
340
341  /**
342   * Returns the next output of the PID controller.
343   *
344   * @param measurement The current measurement of the process variable.
345   * @param goal The new goal of the controller.
346   * @param constraints Velocity and acceleration constraints for goal.
347   * @return The controller's next output.
348   */
349  public double calculate(
350      double measurement, TrapezoidProfile.State goal, TrapezoidProfile.Constraints constraints) {
351    setConstraints(constraints);
352    return calculate(measurement, goal);
353  }
354
355  /**
356   * Reset the previous error and the integral term.
357   *
358   * @param measurement The current measured State of the system.
359   */
360  public void reset(TrapezoidProfile.State measurement) {
361    m_controller.reset();
362    m_setpoint = measurement;
363  }
364
365  /**
366   * Reset the previous error and the integral term.
367   *
368   * @param measuredPosition The current measured position of the system.
369   * @param measuredVelocity The current measured velocity of the system.
370   */
371  public void reset(double measuredPosition, double measuredVelocity) {
372    reset(new TrapezoidProfile.State(measuredPosition, measuredVelocity));
373  }
374
375  /**
376   * Reset the previous error and the integral term.
377   *
378   * @param measuredPosition The current measured position of the system. The velocity is assumed to
379   *     be zero.
380   */
381  public void reset(double measuredPosition) {
382    reset(measuredPosition, 0.0);
383  }
384
385  @Override
386  public void initSendable(SendableBuilder builder) {
387    builder.setSmartDashboardType("ProfiledPIDController");
388    builder.addDoubleProperty("p", this::getP, this::setP);
389    builder.addDoubleProperty("i", this::getI, this::setI);
390    builder.addDoubleProperty("d", this::getD, this::setD);
391    builder.addDoubleProperty("goal", () -> getGoal().position, this::setGoal);
392  }
393}
